meanings.definition: your spoken opinion on a particular matter:
examples: I thought I'd just throw in (= add) my two cents' worth.

meanings.definition: If someone's word is their bond, they always keep a promise:
examples: "But listen, you have to promise never to tell anyone." "My word is my bond."

meanings.definition: a message politely telling someone that you cannot be present at their meeting or party:
examples: The vice chair has sent his apologies - he's abroad at present.
Apologies were received from Phil Baker and Mark Johnson.
Before we start the meeting, do we have any apologies?
I'm afraid I'm going to have to give my apologies for the meeting tomorrow night.
I've had apologies from Amy Smith and Rod Hepburn.

meanings.definition: everything that you do:
examples: I'd hate to be someone really famous with the press reporting my every move.
After that, she was watching his every move.

meanings.definition: all the things that you need or want:
examples: There'll be an assistant there to see to your every need.
Staff in white jackets attend to every need of the club's patrons.
They are hired to travel with the horses, catering to their every need.
He could no longer leave his bed, so his mother had to tend to his every need.
She lives in Italy with an impossibly wealthy and good-looking man who takes care of her every need.

meanings.definition: all the things that you say:
examples: She's such a fascinating lecturer - I was hanging on to her every word.

meanings.definition: used for saying that someone might have a different experience in a particular situation :
examples: I actually love working from home, but your mileage may vary.
I know mileage may vary but I did feel very tired and achy after my second shot.

meanings.definition: a rude way of saying you or yourself, him or himself, me or myself, etc.:
examples: Get your ass in my office now!
I ought to sue his ass for slander.
I was dragging my ass in to work every day in order to feed my family.
If Mona would get her ass out here to Texas, I'd be happy to meet her.

meanings.definition: the one(s) belonging to or connected with the person or group of people being spoken or written to:
examples: Is this pen yours?
Unfortunately my legs aren't as long as yours.
I've got something of yours (= that belongs to you).
Yours is the room on the top floor, on the left.

meanings.definition: used at the beginning of some phrases written at the end of a letter, before giving a name:
examples: Yours, Jack
Yours faithfully/sincerely, K. Maxwell.

meanings.definition: used to show that something belongs to or is connected with people generally:
examples: Other people's children always seem to be better behaved than yours.

meanings.definition: belonging to or connected with the person or people being spoken to, or that which belongs to you:
examples: Our apartment isn’t as large as yours, but it suits us.
I’ve got something of yours (= that belongs to you).

meanings.definition: used at the end of a letter as a way of saying goodbye to someone you know well:
examples: Yours ever, Yvonne.
I will be in touch as soon as I arrive in town. Yours ever, Laurie.
I would be delighted to have the opportunity to work with you again. Yours ever, Paul Cotton.
I look forward to seeing you again soon. Ever yours, Maria Wilson.

meanings.definition: used at the end of a formal letter beginning with "Dear Sir" or "Dear Madam":
examples: I look forward to a reply at your earliest convenience. Yours faithfully, Thomas Jackson
I trust you will deal with this matter promptly. Yours faithfully, Lily Grant
I look forward to hearing from you soon. Yours faithfully, Malcolm Williamson
I also enclose a bill sent to a previous tenant. Yours faithfully, G Mason

meanings.definition: humorous me:
examples: You heard Michael and yours truly talking just a few minutes ago.

meanings.definition: used to end a formal letter that is sent to a particular person:
examples: I look forward to hearing from you. Yours sincerely, Tanya Jones
Many thanks for your assistance in this matter. Sincerely, Dominic Taylor
Please contact me if you require any further information. Yours sincerely, Dr Raj Kumar
I look forward to meeting you on the 7th. Sincerely yours, Edward Harris
If I can be of further assistance, please do not hesitate to contact me. Sincerely, Anna Colwell

meanings.definition: used when the subject of the verb is "you" or the person being spoken to, and the object is the same person:
examples: Be careful with that knife or you'll cut yourself!
Katie, control yourself!

meanings.definition: used for emphasis when the subject is "you":
examples: Did you make the dress yourself?
You can do that yourself.

meanings.definition: used when both the subject and object of the verb are "you" and "you" is also being used to refer to people generally:
examples: You tell yourself everything's all right but you know it's not really.

meanings.definition: the person or people being spoken to; the reflexive form of you:
examples: Be careful with that knife or you’ll cut yourself.

meanings.definition: Yourself is sometimes used to emphasize the subject of the sentence:
examples: Did you girls actually raise this money yourselves?

meanings.definition:
plural of 
        
         yourself
used to mean "you", when addressing a group of people that you are speaking to:
examples: See yous later.

meanings.definition: the period of your life when you are young, or the state of being young:
examples: I was a fairly good football player in my youth.
The first volume is the author's account of his misspent youth in the bars of Dublin.
He looks like a man who's found the secret to eternal youth (= staying young).
You may not have played tennis as often as him, but at least you've got youth on your side (= you are young).

meanings.definition: the time when something is new or not fully developed :
examples: It's hard to believe that such an influential film could have been made when cinema was still in its youth.
This wine should be drunk in its youth.
Because of the relative youth of the internet and the speed of new developments, the legal and ethical codes of conduct are struggling to keep up with the technology.

meanings.definition: a boy or a young man:
examples: Gangs of youths were throwing stones and bottles at the police.

meanings.definition: young people, both male and female, considered as a group:
examples: the youth of today
the nation's disaffected youth
The organization's stated aim is to help at-risk youth.

meanings.definition: relating to, designed for, or consisting of young people:
examples: The study showed that youth crime is on the rise.
There was little money available for sports facilities and youth activities.
With youth unemployment so high, it is not surprising that some school-leavers with qualifications fail to find jobs.
He played for the state youth orchestra.

meanings.definition: the period of your life when you are young, or the state of being young:
examples: I was a good football player in my youth.

meanings.definition: Youth also refers to young people in general:
examples: It’s quite a job, training the youth of the country to be mature, responsible citizens.

meanings.definition: A youth is a boy or a young man:
examples: Our organization helps to shape character, citizenship, and fitness in these youths.

meanings.definition: the part of a sports club that trains young players:
examples: The youth academy starts training talented young players from the age of eight.
The club's youth academy is among the best in the country.

meanings.definition: a place where older children can go to meet other children, play sports, and do other social activities
young people's opinions and the way they live
a form of prison for young people below a certain age who have committed a crime, in England and Wales below the age of 18:
examples: The 17-year-old who caused the fatal accident was sentenced to 18 months' youth custody and banned from driving for 6 years.
The report focused attention on conditions within Britain's largest youth custody centre.
The Youth Custody Service decides which secure unit a child will be sent to.

meanings.definition: a place where people, especially young people, can stay cheaply for short periods when they are travelling
the activity of traveling and staying in different youth hostels:
examples: I used to go youth-hosteling when I was at college.

meanings.definition: the activity of travelling and staying in different youth hostels:
examples: I went youth-hostelling in Europe when I finished college.

meanings.definition: having the qualities that are typical of young people:
examples: At the time I admired his youthful enthusiasm.
She has very youthful skin.

meanings.definition: young:
examples: A youthful president can be good for a country's morale.

meanings.definition: characteristic of young people, or relating to the period of life when you are young:
examples: Her youthful enthusiasm always makes her seem ageless.

meanings.definition: in a way that is similar to, typical of, or relates to young people:
examples: The singer has a youthfully enthusiastic stage presence.
Judy believes that dressing youthfully is about keeping up with trends.

meanings.definition: the quality of being similar to or typical of young people:
examples: His face retained a youthfulness that his wife's had lost.
Aging gracefully is better than keeping up a facade of eternal youthfulness.

meanings.definition: the fact of being young:
examples: His relative youthfulness and message of change resonate on campus.
He was concerned at the extreme youthfulness of Diana, but hoped she would grow into her role.

meanings.definition: an important social or political change that is started by young people:
examples: Some commentators predict a "youthquake" in the coming elections.
There's a youthquake going on and it started online.

meanings.definition: the name of a website that allows people to show videos they have made
a person who often uses the website YouTube, especially someone who makes and appears in videos on the website:
examples: She is a well-known YouTuber who helps brides plan their weddings via video tutorials.

meanings.definition: to make a long, high, unhappy cry, usually when hurt or fighting:
examples: I was woken up by cats yowling outside my window.
On the hills, the foxes yowled and yelped.

meanings.definition: a long, high, unhappy cry, usually made by an animal that is hurt or fighting:
examples: As he lifted her damaged leg the dog let out a fierce yowl.
The squealing became slightly louder, and clearer - the yowls of an animal in pain.

a plant with long, stiff leaves on a thick stem and sometimes with white, bell-shaped flowers
an expression of disgust (= disapproval and dislike):

meanings.definition: disgusting or unpleasant:

belonging to or relating to the former country of Yugoslavia, its people, or its language

examples: Yuk! That's disgusting!

meanings.definition: a territory (= a large area of a country that has some local government but less independence than a province or a state) of northwestern Canada, whose capital city is Whitehorse:
examples: Alaska, Yukon, and Northwest Territories all back the big gas development plans.
The 60th parallel separates the prairie provinces from the Yukon and the Northwest Territories.

meanings.definition: a type of large potato with yellow flesh, originally from Canada:
examples: For the best baked potatoes, choose Yukon Golds and pre-cook them in a microwave before baking to get that crispy skin.
Yukon Gold potatoes have the ideal consistency for making gnocchi.

meanings.definition: Christmas:
examples: The millennium's first Yule was memorable for several reasons.
On this trip you will catch the Yule vibe at Germany's loveliest Christmas market.

meanings.definition: in the past, a winter celebration held by Germanic peoples in the time before Christianity came to their countries:
examples: Yule is an old northern European winter festival.
The tradition of bringing greenery into the house dates back to the pagan festival of Yule, when it was intended to ward off evil spirits.

meanings.definition: in modern times, a winter celebration held by some pagans (= people who belong to a modern religion that includes beliefs and activities that are not from any of the main religions of the world, for example the worship of nature):
examples: Wiccans celebrate Yule around December 21, the winter solstice, because nights then start to become shorter.

a cylinder-shaped chocolate cake, eaten at Christmas, that is decorated to look like a log (= a thick piece of wood from a tree)
a large piece of wood, usually burned on Christmas Eve

meanings.definition: used to say that food tastes or smells very good
used for saying that food tastes or smells very good :
examples: After the party games there was some lovely food. Yum yum!
We love pizza! Yum-yum!

meanings.definition: tasting extremely good:
examples: I think I'll have some more of that yummy chocolate cake.

meanings.definition: sexually attractive:
examples: And tell her to bring along that yummy brother of hers.

meanings.definition: (of food) tasting extremely good:

yes:

meanings.definition: a young person who lives in a city, earns a lot of money, and spends it doing fashionable things and buying expensive possessions:
examples: They're just a couple of yuppies with more money than sense.

meanings.definition: a young, educated person who lives in a city and is successful in business, and who has a life style that involves spending a lot of money:
